title: Togetherness required at Tottenham, urges Mauricio Pochettino following Liverpool defeat
text:
Tottenham manager Mauricio Pochettino called on the club to stick together as they fell into the bottom half and saw any hope of a title challenge effectively ended after just ten games.

A 2-1 defeat to Liverpool leaves Spurs an eye-catching 16 points behind the league leaders. It is a sobering gap between the clubs who met in last year’s Champions League final.

Yet Pochettino saw enough to enthuse rather than depress him in a high class meeting at Anfield, Mohamed Salah’s second-half penalty the difference after Harry Kane's early strike was cancelled out by Jordan Henderson.

“After five and a half years it’s a moment to be all together and show our support,” said Pochettino.

“In this season we deserve more points on the table. It’s a moment to stay strong, to keep pushing. Of course in a different season this game could have finished two or three nil for us. But today for us it is a different way and we must stay calm and take the best decisions for the future.”
